website_summaries.verdict: A great way to have the best of clipless and platform worlds on a single pedal.
pros: Dual sided design sports a mount for SPD-compatible cleats on one side and a flat, mount biking-oriented surface on the other, allowing riders to choose their preferred riding style
cons: Pedals tend to drop down into the cleat position from the weight of the platform

customer_reviews.title: not a bad first set of clip in pedals with platforms.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a my first road bike. They are ok. since it was my first road bike, I wanted to find a clip in pedal that was also a platform pedal. Here are the pros and cons. Pro: - come with correct clip - are good platform pedals. - all metal construction Cons: - They are very heavy - not the easiest to get out of when slowing down. - Have very tall platform on both sides, I had to trim the grip down with a dremel to make it work with my shoes. - do not spin very easily. I have heard that it is intentional so that they will stay upright while clipping in and out.
customer_reviews.author: savings monger

customer_reviews.title: poor design and materials
customer_reviews.text: I tried these pedals and had to remove and return them. The the cleat side, the metal rim has teeth that prevent my bike shoes that have recessed cleats to engage. Why would you put teeth on the clip side? Makes no sense. Then the screws that insert into the shoes seem to be made of soft metal and strips easily. Also, when turning the axle, there is almost a friction grittiness to them--the Shimano's turn with smoothness. I ended up getting some Shimano pedals PD-M324 instead. Much better quality for only $20 more. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: 4 months of light use - Bearings crushed
customer_reviews.text: Two of the bearings on my right pedal literally smashed to pieces. The pedal no longer spun. I am not an obese person, nor do I bike all that much. The grease is also really low quality inside the axle. These pedals didn't even make it to a winter. I would recommend paying a bit more for nicer pedals and saving the headache of buying new bearings and having to reinstall them.
customer_reviews.author: Corey J. Poland

customer_reviews.title: They work.  It's a starter pedal.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these because they are cheap aluminum. One curb hit and you may permanently bend them without being able to straighten them out. Also, they are noisy. They squeak and I cannot figure out where to apply oil, so I am considering upgrading to actual Shimano SPD pedals with a cage. There was just no cost justification until now. I guess you get what you pay for sometimes. These would be great for a leisure bike or a child's starter pedal. They are definitely better than toe-clips but these ones in particular are not very durable. Don't pay more than $25 to $30 for them or it's a waste. Go with Shimano if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with some shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have Bontrager SSR clipless shoes and they DO NOT work with these pedals because the teeth on the cage on the clip side prevent the recessed shoe clip from reaching down far enough to 'clip in'. I successfully modified the pedal by grinding off the two outer teeth and this allowed the shoe to clip in as it should. Took about 7 minutes including time to set up the grinder. They work fine now I would advise anyone to just pay the little extra and get the shimano dual sided pedal instead
customer_reviews.author: Y. Mosca

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for the money. AS many posters have said, the bearings are much too tight. Pretty simple to pull the caps and loosen up just a touch to get them perfect. The clips also do always orient down to when wearing clip in shoes you will have to flip the pedal every time you want to clip in, but I figured that would be the case before purchasing just from looking at the photo. I have done a couple of 75 mile rides along with a few short runs here and there probably about 20 miles each and they are holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: LS Review

customer_reviews.title: Rode them for 2 and 1/2 years with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals. I've had them for two and a half years and have not experience any problems. The spring tension was initially a bit stiff but I never had any difficulties clipping in and out of my pedals. The only challenge with these pedals is finding right side to clip into. Sometimes, the flat side will be up and you have to flip it over with your shoe. It only took me a few days to learn how to do this without looking at my feet. Overall, a great purchase. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedal for Spin Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the stock pedals on my indoor spin bike. They worked great once I got them properly tightened to the crank arm. I use these several times each week and they have worked fantastically.
customer_reviews.author: Fahillion Tech

customer_reviews.title: Alright Pedals
customer_reviews.text: I got these pedals because I am a college student that wants the availability of riding around campus without clips, but wants to go riding on the weekends. These pedals are extremely hard to clip into because you have to make sure that they are on the right side. When you are up on a mountain trail it is nearly impossible to clip into these unless you have super powers. If I would have known how these were going to be, I would not have purchased them. They are just awkward pedals and if you ride with anyone you will just end up slowing them down.
customer_reviews.author: B123

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had to do the bearing adjustment that others mentioned but it wasn't too tough. I like the versatility these pedals offer as well as the fact that they are significantly cheaper than similar shimano pedals. After the adjustment they work fine and seem to be very solidly constructed. The only negative I would have is that they are very tricky to get used to because the cleat side tends to fall to the bottom when your shoes aren't clipped in, making clipping back in kind of tricky. This was exacerbated by the fact that they were my first clipless pedals so I wasn't used to doing this anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B

customer_reviews.title: Loughridge's advice and loosen the bearings and they work fine now. The cleats are cheap and lost paint ...
customer_reviews.text: Long story short you get what you pay for. As noted in several previous reviews the pedals came outta the box with stiff bearings that barely moved. I followed K. Loughridge's advice and loosen the bearings and they work fine now. The cleats are cheap and lost paint and bent when i removed them. Basically its a cheap $20 pedal set. If you want nice get the Shimano PD-M324 SPD's. I will be after these wear out which I fear will be soon. For now they work great and have no operational issues.
customer_reviews.author: K in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these pedals. One for my Trek FX 7.3 and one for my wife's, then girlfriend's, Trek FX 7.5 WSD. While her pedals are still going strong my pair shredded the bearings after about three months of commuting. First they started this loud clicking when I put on a load, such as going uphill and then the right pedal locked up solid. When I attempted to maintenance these pedals one just fell apart and one ripped apart. So I am batting 500. I replaced mine with Shimano 534s.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy these pedals.
customer_reviews.text: I got my pedals and immediately was greeted with the impressively low quality before I even got them on the bike! The bearings were very rough, made a lot of noise when spinning the pedals BY HAND, and they are stiff. I am returning mine for a full refund. Save yourself the troubles and look for a better product elsewhere. These are definitively not what you are looking for. They are made in Taiwan for anyone who is wondering. Really bad product... avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzlyAdams

customer_reviews.title: Wider than Shimano
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pedals for my wife's hybrid so she can ride with either gym shoes or her biking shoes. They clip in and out easily. The only problem is that she has a small frame bike and when in a banking turn, she has to be careful not to scrap the pedal on the ground. They are about 4 3/8 inches wide vs 4 inches for the similar Shimano pedal. I have the Shimano pedal on my bike, so I just swapped with her, giving her several more degrees of lean in a banking turn. If ground clearance isn't an issue, they are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer said, the bearings were too tight. One pedal would spin about half a turn if I tried spinning it freely. The other wasn't "too bad." Ended up following K. Loughridge instructions and took them apart. They were actually pretty tough to take apart because of the lock tight on the screws. Anyways, they spin freely and easily now, they have plenty of grip on both sides. Been riding with normal gym shoes while I wait for my new shoes to be delivered. ps - cleats are included
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best of both worlds. An absolute necessity if you bike on the street and also do some trail riding. I have discovered it is dangerous to be clipped in during city traffic rides. This works but I gave them away due to the weight and bearings not being silky smooth. Don't get me wrong, for 99% of the riders out there, this is fine, I just ended up spending a lot more money for some lighter and better bearing convertible pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Voltaire

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as some reviews made me expect this product to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as bad as some reviews made me expect this product to be. I thought that for the price I would give it a try and I'm pretty satisfied with the purchase. I checked all the bearings and they are all properly greased.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent commuter clips
customer_reviews.text: I use my bicycle for commuting. These pedals give me the flexibility of riding the bicycle using regular shoes or bicycle shoes with cleats. The price is very reasonable and the clips work great. I read a lot of comments about how these clips needed some adjusting before they worked correctly. For me, they worked as shipped. All I had to do was install them. I love the extra power I'm able to get by using these pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: Bearings got ruff turning pretty quick. I greased and set bearings lightly back together as they didnt feel great new. plus some reviews also suggested. Went crappy fast. junk in my eyes. gettting some Shimanos, we will see how thez turns out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great combo pedals
customer_reviews.text: great combo pedals. i didn't get to use them long though because apparently the threads in my cranks were damaged by the previous pedals adn bot of these fell out on the road before I completed my first ride, making the trek back to my car somewhat of a challenge...riding with no pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Rathbun, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So either side is good for flat use
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding these for a few months now with no problems. I wish there were clips on both sides. The clip is low enough that it's not that noticeable with regular shoes on. So either side is good for flat use. But is sucks to try to clip in in a hurry to find out I got the wrong side.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Use all the time
customer_reviews.text: For the price of these pedals you cannot beat them. I ride a GT Force 2.0 primarily clipped in. I have a set of clip only pedals from Crank Bros that are great, but these pedals for a quarter of the price drive a hard bargain. Plus having the option to not clip in for short periods is a huge plus. I've recommended these to two other using buddies who now ride with these too. Not to mention the pedals come with extra Shimano style shoe clips. I've ridden 50-60 times and haven't had a single
customer_reviews.author: Alex Sherman

customer_reviews.title: They are Alright
customer_reviews.text: Bearing quality isn't the best out of the box and are a little more difficult to clip into than my Shimano 520's They do require a few more degrees of a turn to unclip as well compared to my 520's. Work well for commuting and rail trail riding. Even with the lower quality, Still satisfied with the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Weber

customer_reviews.title: Use with or without clip-on shoes
customer_reviews.text: I recently was given a couple of road bike parts and needed pedals and this one was a great fit for future options. I don't have biking shoes but may get some in the future. These pedals allow me to have that option. Works great and good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought a spinner bike used and it did not have cleated pedals. I was a bit annoyed as an avid rider I ride with cleated shoes. So in search of the best deal I found these pedals. I've been riding on them for the last few weeks. The ride is so comfortable on by feet. Very nice shape, easy to install and they come with extra cleats for your shoes! Awesome price, and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: TonicShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good but!
customer_reviews.text: They are an awesome alternative to expensive pedals that do the same. They take a bit of adjusting and some breaking in but after a month of use I'm happy. The spring inside is a lot tighter than the shamano pedal that these are copied from.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pedals, sturdy and not to heavy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pedals, sturdy and not to heavy, but the bearing were to tight, I had to take them apart and loosen them up. I will change the bearings to ceramic.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the "kid puller." Great to be able to quickly switch between standard & SPD pedals when I'm riding with the kids or running to the store. Not the lightest compared to Shimano or a different brand but you can't beat the price. Plus if I was really concerned about weight I'd just use an SPD pedal.
customer_reviews.author: M. White

customer_reviews.title: look great, but need some help
customer_reviews.text: These pedals look great and make a nice statement on my Trek, but the performance was a bit rough out of the box. Like another reviewer stated... the bearings were a bit tight and the pedals were rough when turned by hand; almost as if they weren't cleaned very well during assembly and dirt was in the bearing grease. So before I even put them on the bike I had to break them down, clean all the loose ball bearings, races and capture nuts and re-greased them. Now they perform as good as they look. Good parts, but you may need to be `handy' to get the performance where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Lighthiking46s

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty heavy, I will not recommend this if you ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to learn how to clip to my bike. They are pretty heavy, I will not recommend this if you have some experience riding and want something lighter. Good for learning and beginners.
customer_reviews.author: NickNico

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for the price. As others mentioned, the bearings are tight and the pedal doesn't spin freely out of the box. Also, the clips are pretty tight even when loosened substantially, but they seem to be breaking in nicely after a few rides. Great entry-level pedals. Eventually I plan to move these to my mtn bike and get nicer pedals for my road bike, but these are great for starters.
customer_reviews.author: Bigkat5000

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Pedals
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy for "alloy", but versatile, the weight is all in the center portion. You can unscrew and remove the clip less receivers and use as standard pedals, install toe clips, whatever you want. I have these on a black Specialized Rockhopper and they look great. The quality also appears very good, but haven't had a chance to put them through the ringer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bartimus Max

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good if you don't want to spend the Shimano price.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: left pedal developed a bad bearing 2 weeks after use. outer construction is fairly durable altho rust spots developed after 3 weeks from riding thru a puddle or 2. I'd avoid it and go with a better product. the manufacturer will not replace them as there seems to be no warranty
customer_reviews.author: J. Peri

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with these pedals when I first got them, but through use they've become worse. I did have to adjust the bearing pressure, as suggested in other reviews. One pedal works great; no problems. The other has issues in the bearings. If I loosen bearing pressure until it turns freely, it gets sloppy. If I tighten it enough to take the sloppiness out, it binds and I can feel the bearings grinding. It also makes a really annoying clicking sound on each revolution. I'm sure it's just inferior quality bearings, but you get what you pay for. Maybe a different set wouldn't have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: scott252

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, spend a little more it will be worth it in the long run
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the bearings in these are garbage and they dont spin smoothly at all. Also I couldn't keep my shimanos clipped in no matter how tight. I finally overtightened and the screw/spring broke off and made my fingers numb for about 10 minutes. Avoid these pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them. Work great and great quality
customer_reviews.text: 3 of my bikes have these. I love them. Work great and great quality! A+++++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Demarest Twins

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use pedal
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great value and perfect for someone like me that spends time on the trail, but also uses my bike for transport with normal shoes. They are easy to get used to (finding the right side), are wearing well, and are good value. Def. recommended for anyone that needs a multi-use pedal and doesn't want to pay a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: HSG83

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedal power
customer_reviews.text: These pedals were to replace the original equipment on a new commuter bike. The pedals arrived quickly. The directions in the package were easy to understand for making adjustments before I used them. They are much better than the original equipment (all alloy not plastic)and they look great on the bike. I am considering buying another set for my road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Bearings wear out too soon.
customer_reviews.text: I had a set that clicked as I rode. The left pedal clicked through the chain ring rotation. I had lubricated them before and the clicking stopped. I thought it was just the spring in the clip. It was the bearings. I bought a new set and the new right one started clicking immediately. I replaced it with the right one I had just taken off. These are cheap and don't hold up well to long rides. I recommend getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: CAL351

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I had this about a month now. It has made a great difference in performance. I'm still uncertain about having the bindings on only one side. I've not used them without the cleats, so it might have been easier to just get two sided peddles. I do like that the bearing are on the tight side, it makes it much simpler getting the right side up. There is not enough resistance to actually notice in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Treat

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for great price!
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my mountain bike that I use to pull the kids on the trailer. That way, I can use regular shoes when I am pulling, and clip in when it is just me. Takes a little getting use to (first clipless) but working great now. Super easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Tom K

customer_reviews.title: Pedals
customer_reviews.text: Good pedals for the money. They need to be worked on out of the box, requiring the bearings to be repressed or greased. Great for clipping in on the way up and staying out on the way down. Best of both worlds. Basket isn't the toughest. I bent it the second day out on a rock, but it hasn't affected the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Idahoan

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to have the option to ride in whatever shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for my wife, who is new to clipless. They arrived quickly and installed in seconds. They function perfectly. It's nice to have the option to ride in whatever shoes you're wearing, and I may pick up another set for one of my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Campus pedals rock!
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are cheap in price but don't lack in quality. Clips on one side for SPD shoes and a plane pedal on the other. These are great for any bike that you plan to use for commuting or would like the ability to take a short ride around the neighborhood without having to put on your road shoes.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: 1st clipless
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try clipless pedals for the first time and these fit the bill. The non clip side is just like any normal pedal. The clip side works great and does have an adjustment for how tight or loose to set them. The pedals also came with a set of cleats which saves some money as with other pedals you have to buy those separate. Overall I am very happy with these pedals, everything on them is metal, even that red part in the middle, so they seem like they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Overall, quite nice
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed, easily adjusted. I'm using them with a road bike that I take on gravel trails semi-regularly, and nothing has gotten stuck in the mechanism. When I don't feel like clipping in, the flat surface provides good grip, and when I do the cleat side locks and unlocks easily.
customer_reviews.author: bicycledad

customer_reviews.title: Great - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value. They do exactly what I was hoping, which is cruising around half the time without clip shoes and then doing some more semi-serious rides half the time. Obviously if you're real serious into cycling/biking then you should get pedals that are double-sided for clips.
customer_reviews.author: Seri

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife's hybrid and they are an outstanding buy... cleats are included! had the cleats installed and the pedals swapped within 10 minutes and after a couple of adjustments on the cleat release tension... we were off and riding. I would get myself a pair... If I could ever find a reasonable pair of size 16 cycling shoes... lol
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous pedals
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are a threat to your safety, health, and longevity! I have used SPD pedals for many years and bought these for a second bike. I loosened them up, went out for a test ride, and immediately fell when I could not get out of them. Normally only a few degrees of twisting will release the foot from SPDs. These require an almost impossible 45 degrees of twisting! Do not buy these pedals! I returned them for a full refund and am going to spend more money on something decent.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Trotter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PEDALS
customer_reviews.text: I've had these pedals on my bike for about 2 weeks now and I must say they are a great pedal for the money! I haven't had any issues with pedals as of yet, like others may have mentioned as far as technical issues. I would recommend these pedals if you want a solid pedal for off-road riding and street riding.
customer_reviews.author: joeikon

customer_reviews.title: great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these pedals for my mountain bike several months ago. I ride trails two to three times weekly and you can't beat these pedals for the money. They are exactly as advertised. I am very satisfied and would recomend them. The only drawback is that they are heavy but no heavier than the stock pedals my bike came with so no big deal. Shoe cleats are included so don't buy cleats separately.
customer_reviews.author: C. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the product.
customer_reviews.text: Pedals did not come with the 3mm wrench to adjust clips. More than likely you will need to adjust. I had to take off most all the tension to get my shoe clipped in. They have become easier with a few rides. Pedals came with cleats, which I did not expect. Don't think that was in the description. I did not need the cleats. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: These pedals worked out great. They are perfect for the casual bike ride and the clipless side come in handy when needed for rain or mountain biking. It's not very hard to discern which side is which either. The clipless pedals are adjustable and very easy to get into and the non clipless side is grippy enough to rely on for when you don't need the clips. I would definitely buy these pedals again.
customer_reviews.author: Sgs182

customer_reviews.title: Fit Perfect - Great Budget Pedals
customer_reviews.text: Great budget pedals that I used on my Diamondback Overdrive. They worked great with the pair of Keens I purchased. They do not spin as freely as i would like, but are great choices for a set of cheap pedals.
customer_reviews.author: N Buck

customer_reviews.title: Bad clip in
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately could never get the adjustment right so I never could dismount cleanly. Great pedal if you aren’t going to clip in.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY

customer_reviews.title: just what my indoor bike needed!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted inexpensive pedals to use on my indoor bike, and these really fit the bill. I am not a biking expert but I do find indoor cycling to be a great way to burn calories and my heart rate up. My shoes clip into the pedals easily and stay in place throughout the ride.
customer_reviews.author: babygirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedals
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these pedals!!! I have had them for 6 months and no problems at all. These are just what I was looking for, if I want to wear my bike shoes and clip in I can or if I just want to ride around the house in regular shoes I can do that also. I highly recommend these to any one who is looking for a two sided pedal or even a budget clip in pedal.
customer_reviews.author: All4rc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit, smooth riding on stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased an upright (spinning) bike. It did not come with these "clip" type pedals, which I really like for exercise, as I have the shoes. I was a little nervous that the screw thread wasn't a standard size, but they fit right on and are working flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: LeoSantaman

customer_reviews.title: really good pedals
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pedals for my 2011 Cannondale Bad Boy Solo hybrid. They pop! Haven't had any issues with them and I appreciate the jump on and go, duel sided design - meaning no clipless shoes required. Great pedals, bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks, Loughridge!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my XLC MTB pedals. As other posters stated, the bearings were excessively tight and needed attention or they wouldn't be usable. After disassembly and slightly loosening the bearing nut, they work great. Thanks to Loughridge and others who took the time to show guys like me (not mechanically inclinded) how to make the adjustments. I would have sent them back had I not read their posts.
customer_reviews.author: jo anne hall

customer_reviews.title: great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: Love that they give you the clips for your shoes WITH this product! Great value and smooth pedal. The all metal/alloy construction allows for a comforable fit to the shoe that locks with the sole. Love the easy adjustment to the tightness of the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Jdohboy

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal for the price/beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals... I read somewhere that they would spin too much. I didn't have this problem. My first pair and i don't have one complaint about them. love the fact that I have the option to use the other side to pedal without clipping in, which is a must in NYC.
customer_reviews.author: mMaisonet

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am using these pedals on my commuter bike with a 34m round trip commute and around town with sandals/flip-flops. They are a good combination and the 'clip' side does roll to the bottom so you don't have to frequently rotate the pedal when in regular shoes. There were exactly what I was looking for a fair price. No issues yet with about 300m on them.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Brown

customer_reviews.title: Work well and you can simplify the recommended adjustment with the right tools.
customer_reviews.text: If you have an angled ring spanner you can make the adjustments merely by prying off the black cap and loosening the cone. After that they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Nic B-F

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Like many have said, these pedals come a little tight. No biggie. They work great with my spd shoes, and it's nice to have an option when you don't have your shoes. The clips were included. *Update* After almost a year of use, they seem to be holding up well. I'm very happy I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln Tony

customer_reviews.title: Not for hardcore downhilling, probably great for anything else.
customer_reviews.text: these look and function great. solid build quality. great for anyone who wants an upgrade over the standard pedal for your casual to moderate intensity biking needs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good pedal, bearing could be better, no hex slot
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice enough pedals, the red paint look sharp. I have not tried them riding yet. The thing is I need a pedal wrench to install this as the shafts do not have hex key slot on it. All my Shimano pedals have them, made it easier to change with my existing mini tool. Seem to be as heavy as my Shimano M324 pedal, but a bit longer, so got to be more careful in making sharp turns. I'm keeping them.
customer_reviews.author: ANov

customer_reviews.title: Pedals work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These pedals were bought so that I could turn my rode bike into a commute bike and not have to change the pedals for when I want to go on a long ride. Now that I have done both and had no problems with using my clip-in shoes I am very happy with my purchase. They also provide enough grip on the flat side that when I am using my Clarks to get to work or school my feet don't slip. Very happy with them, and they were easy to instal.
customer_reviews.author: DannyO

customer_reviews.title: Great to not always need to put on bike shoes to cruise up the Bar&Grill or run some local errands.  On the heavy side -1 star
customer_reviews.text: Great to not always need to put on bike shoes to cruise up the Bar&Grill or run some local errands. On the heavy side -1 star Cannondale V800
customer_reviews.author: Spendtoomuchhere

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: For twenty odd dollars I did not know what to expect from these pedals. I am extremely happy I took the chance. The clips are adjustable for easy clip in and clip out (good for stopping!) and they are broad, offering extra support for my big feet. And if for some reason I don't have my shoes I just flip them over and I have a regular pedal. I was also surprised that these pedals came with the cleats for your shoes. A lot of value here!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler White

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Pedals work great. Like everyone else I had to adjust the bearings because they were too tight when I got them. Very easy to adjust the hardest part was removing the screws out of the black portions of the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Fred B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I could have sprung for the shimanos but I have no regrets. They installed easy, and can be easily used without the shoes. All in all, a must have if you are riding.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are sturdy and well designed. Some might consider them a bit heavy, but I'm just a average Joe rider who's not counting ounces. Considering that they are only a bit more expensive than plastic pedals you can buy at WalMart, they are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Anybody

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Put these on the spinning bike in the basement and they work just as planned. They are heavy, but for what I'm using them for... what do I care.
customer_reviews.author: ScubaCobra

customer_reviews.title: Easy to jump on my bike to run to the ...
customer_reviews.text: received these very quickly and they are exactly what I was looking for. Easy to jump on my bike to run to the store or wherever without having to put on my bike shoes, but if I want to go for a more serious ride I can put on my clipless shoes and in no time I am locked into my bike and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery W Retke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this is so cool. I can use my regular shoes with my MTB pedals now and I love it. I found that one of my pairs of MTB shoes didn't fit the pedals, but they even send a pair of the clips to attach to the shoes and these fit to a tee of course. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John in Pensacola

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap pedals and they need some adjusting before use. I had to loosen the nut that holds the bearings and shim up the clips so my cleats could engage.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Niewald

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It does what it should. Price was good.
customer_reviews.author: GLS MN COLD

customer_reviews.title: Now I can wear cleats or tennis shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great to have a pedal that works with or without cleats. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: ThumbHead

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great. One of the pedals was tightened too much and I had to open them up and adjust the bolt slightly, but afterward worked perfectly. Great for riding in regular old shoes.
customer_reviews.author: bsb

customer_reviews.title: great pedals
customer_reviews.text: these pedals rock. I have had no issues with them and they were exactly as ordered. If you need versatility of having pedals and clips this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hobby

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these pedals. I am new to using clipless shoes so I need something that I could use with or without. These do exactly what I needed them for.
customer_reviews.author: Michele S. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works great just as it was advertised. I would not hesitate to recommend this product to any one who is considering purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sherlock

customer_reviews.title: Great first clipless pedals
customer_reviews.text: These were part of my first foray into clipless pedals and they have performed very well. It takes some getting used to, but having the platforms on the other side have helped on those short runs when I just can't get my shoes locked in. Seem to be well built, and they included a pair of SPD cleats which worked with my super small budget.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great set of pedals!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this set of pedals. They are easy to install and are very sturdy. You can use them with or without clips and they go great with my bike color.
customer_reviews.author: RonAmaze

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pedals for a couple of weeks now, and they are pretty good! I haven't tried the clipless feature yet, but I intend on it in the future. These pedals work great with regular running shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Eichler

customer_reviews.title: No adjustment necessary
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed these of my indoor spin bike. They were easy to install, you just have to pay attention to the threading. I had no issues getting my shoes in the clips. I have pearl izumi shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anna R.

customer_reviews.title: cool strong lightweight design
customer_reviews.text: very strong and dual sided with regular and adjustable shoe pedals. Teflon like o-ring inside to prevent wear on the bearings.
customer_reviews.author: George Rye

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are durable and work well. Very happy with them. No issues as mentioned in many of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardaj

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: I think these are great, if I wait just a fraction of a second the pedal will flip on its own to the regular (not the clips side)
customer_reviews.author: InHillcrest

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals! Easy to install and please note they come with the clips for your shoes (Added Bonus!!) They are very easy to flip over when riding to access either side of the pedal. They are a little on the heavy side but well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: chris h

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal for the price after loosening the bearings!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great with my black and red bike and feels great after loosening the bearing nut as recommended by other reviews. Easy to loosen and made a world of difference in the rotation of the pedal.
customer_reviews.author: RWM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these were great, gave them to my son on his new bike
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Good pedals.
customer_reviews.text: These are the first pair of clipless pedals I have ever used. Price was important because I didn't want to spend a lot of money on something I might not like. I have no complaints about these. They are good for the price and I like that like you can adjust the pedals to release your shoe easier or more difficult depending on how you like to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Videtich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product... I own two sets that get plenty of use both on and off road
customer_reviews.author: Celeste E. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Good pedals
customer_reviews.text: They are good pedals. But they are a little hard to clip in and out of. Especially on the left foot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: clipless pedals with the pedal
customer_reviews.text: Very exciting stuff! Not so much. They function as expected/desired. I can use clipless shoes or regular shoes. Now when riding with my kids I don't have to be a doof in bike shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Andy E. Radvany

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very good pedal
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and good overall. The pedals are very good quality and so is the metal that they are made of. On mine I felt a very, very slight roughness in the bearing compared to a $300 pair of pedals with ABEC 9 rated bearings. You can only notice it when spinning by hand and can't feel it when on the bike. Plan to buy two more sets for other bikes. They are work great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Arty

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Really good pedals for the price ! They seem like they will last for a while , bearings did come to tight so you will have to loosen them up a bit, but overall great buy ! I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Henry831

product_meta.title: XLC PD-S01 Pedals 2016
product_meta.description: Size:9/16"XLC Alloy MTB / Trekking Dual Sided Pedal Clipless 1 Side / Cage Other 9/16" ! This is a Great Dual Sided Pedal ! You will not find any like it under 0, Clipless One side / Cage One Side ! Aluminium body / aluminium cage. CroMo axle. Ball bearing. Weighs 466g. 112 x 65 x 35 mm. Shimano SPD compatible .
feature_bullets: XLC Alloy MTB / Trekking Dual Sided Pedal Clipless 1 Side / Cage Other 9/16" !
This is a Great Dual Sided Pedal ! You will not find any like it under 0, Clipless One side / Cage One Side !
Aluminium body / aluminium cage. CroMo axle. Ball bearing.
Weighs 466g. 112 x 65 x 35 mm. Shimano SPD compatible .
